title: Who was the worst VP? - Quora

response.answer_text: Who was the worst VP? It would be hard to top Aaron Burr. Burr was the third VP of the United States. He served under Thomas Jefferson. He shot and killed Alexander Hamilton in Weehawken, New Jersey, while Burr was the sitting Vice President. This event was called a “duel” at the time. Today we would call it a murder. Burr was never punished for it, of course.

Probably Spiro Agnew, VP from 1969-1973. Resigned in disgrace as a result of corruption scandals from his time as governor of Maryland. Succeeded by Gerald Ford, who became president when Richard Nixon also resigned in disgrace (for reasons entirely unrelated to Agnew's disgrace). Fun fact: if you rearrange the letters in Spiro Agnew's name you can get the phrase “grow a penis.”

The reason they picked Joe Biden to be VP was so that if anyone had the idea of knocking off Obama then you would have Joe Biden as president. He was a party flunky and a clown and Obama’s VP was the best place to put him. Now somehow they think he would be good as President, with yet again another party flunky as VP.
Vice President Aaron Burr shot and killed former Treasury Secretary Alexander Hamilton in 1804. I don’t think any of the others can mach that.
How about Aaron Burr? Killed a legendary Founding Father and then was charged with Treason for trying to create an new country for himself. Lived in Exile and disgrace until his death.
